item.title: About
item.description: What is it? A community fund that provides no-strings-attached grants for artists and programmers working with or interested in working with hydra video synth. Each award is for the amount of $200 USD. « Apply now! » What is hydra? Hydra is a live code-able video synth and coding environment that runs directly in the browser. It is free and open-source and made for beginners and experts alike. For more information, see the hydra web editor.

item.title: Apply
item.description: Apply now! Applications to the hydra community fund are open from ___ to_ Tuesday 3rd May 17:00 BST ___. Applications submitted after this date will not be considered. The questions to be answered are referenced below: Name Email address What would you like to use the grant for? - e.g. organizing a workshop, event, or study group writing a tutorial, documentation, fanzine, video working on an add-on, extension, or library (other things that we have not yet imagined !

item.title: Contact
item.description: Please contact Olivia Jack at hydra.video.synth@gmail.com with any questions :)

item.title: Support
item.description: Support Hydra community fund is supported entirely by donations. You can support here:

item.title: Team
item.description: The core team for the hydra community fund consists of Olivia Jack https://ojack.xyz/ Antonio Roberts (he/him) https://hellocatfood.com For each round of community funding we invite external judges. [MONRHEA] https://monrhea.bandcamp.com/ Previous judges If you are interested in being a judge for future rounds please get in touch Contact Please contact us at hydra.video.synth@gmail.com with any questions :)
